title: Mom’s (best ever) Split Pea Soup
directions: Put the water, onions, carrots, & ham bone, in a large pot together and bring to a boil.
Add all remaining ingredients except for the potato. Reduce the heat and let the soup simmer for approximately 2 hours, stirring occasionally.
Add the potato about 40 minutes prior to eating. When the potato pieces are done, you’re ready to eat! It’s as easy as that ;)
ingredients: 2 cups (a 1 lb. bag) of dry split peas
2 teaspoons salt (optional- the ham bone adds salt to the soup already)
1 large russet potato, chopped into cubes
